sloka.english: There is nothing in this world so purifying as Knowledge. He who is perfected by yoga finds it in himself in the fullness of time.
sloka.hindi: nahi jna:ne:na sadrusam pavithram iha vidyathe: | thathsvayam yo:ga samsiddhaha ka:le:na::thmani vindathi || 38
sloka.sanskrit: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते | तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ||४-३८||

sloka.english: It is the man of faith who gains knowledge - the man who is intent on it and who has mastery over his senses; having gained knowledge, he comes ere long to the supreme peace.
sloka.hindi: sraddha:va:n labhathe: yo:gam thath paras samyathe:ndriyaha | jna:nam labdhva: para:m sa:nthim achire:n a:dhi gachhathi || 39
sloka.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः | ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||४-३९||

sloka.english: But the man of doubt, without knowledge and without faith, is lost; for him who is given to doubt there is neither this world nor that beyond, nor happiness.
sloka.hindi: ajnascha: sraddha dha:nascha samsaya:thma: vinasyathi | na:yam lo:ko::sthi na paro: na sukham samsaya:thmanaha || 40
sloka.sanskrit: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति | नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ||४-४०||

sloka.english: He who has renounced all action by means of yoga, who has severed all doubt by means of knowledge - him self-possessed, no actions bind, O Dhananjaya!
sloka.hindi: yo:ga sannyastha karma:nam jna:na sanchanna samsayam | a:thmavantham na karma:ni nibadhnanthi dhananjaya! || 41
sloka.sanskrit: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् | आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ||४-४१||

sloka.english: Therefore, with the sword of Self-realization sever you this doubt, bred of ignorance, which has crept into thy heart! Betake thyself to yoga and arise, O Bharata!
sloka.hindi: thasma:d ajna:na sambhu:tham hruthsttham jna:na:sin a::thmanaha | chhithvainam samsayam yo:gam a:thishtto:th thishtta bha:ratha! || 42
sloka.sanskrit: तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः | छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||४-४२||

sloka.english: Arjuna Said: you laudest renunciation of actions, O Krishna, whilst at the same time you laudest performance of action; tell me for a certainty which is the better.
sloka.hindi: arjuna uva:cha sannya:sam karmana:m krushna! punaryo:gam cha samsasi | yachhre:ya e:thayo:re:kam thanme: bru:hi sunischitham || 1
sloka.sanskrit: अथ पञ्चमोऽध्यायः | संन्यासयोगः अर्जुन उवाच | संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि | यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ||५-१||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Renunciation and performance of action both lead to salvation; but of the two, karmayoga (performance) is better than sannyasa (renunciation).
sloka.hindi: sri:bhagava:n uva:cha sannya:sah karma yo:gas cha nissre:yasakara: vubhow | thayo:sthu karmasannya:sa:th karmayo:go: visishyathe: || 2
sloka.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ | तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ||५-२||

sloka.english: Him one should know as ever renouncing who has no dislikes and likes; for he who is free from the pairs of opposites is easily released from bondage.
sloka.hindi: jne:yas sanithya sannya:si: yo: na dveshti na ka:nkshathi | nirdvandvo:hi maha:baho: sukham bandha:th pramuchyathe: || 3
sloka.sanskrit: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति | निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ||५-३||

sloka.english: It is the ignorant who speak of sankhya and yoga as different, not so those who have knowledge. He who is rightly established even in one wins to the fruit of both.
sloka.hindi: sa:nkhya yo:gow prutthak ba:la:h pravadanthi na panditha:ha | e:kam apya:stthithas samyak ubhayo:r vindathe: phalam || 4
sloka.sanskrit: साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः | एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ||५-४||

sloka.english: The goal that the sankhyas attain is also reached by the yogins. He sees truly who sees both sankhya and yoga as one.
sloka.hindi: yathsa:nkhyaih pra:pyathe: stthanam thadyo:gairapi gamyathe: | e:kam sa:nkhyam cha yo:gam cha yah pasyathi sa pasyathi || 5
sloka.sanskrit: यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते | एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||५-५||

sloka.english: But renunciation, O Mahabahu, is hard to attain except by yoga; the ascetic equipped with yoga attains Brahman ere long.
sloka.hindi: sannyasas thu maha:ba:ho: duhkham a:pthumayo:gathaha | yo:gayuktho: munir bramha na chire:na:dhigachhathi || 6
sloka.sanskrit: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः | योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||५-६||

sloka.english: The yogi who has cleared himself, has gained mastery over his mind and all his senses, who has become one with the Atman in all creation, although he acts he remains unaffected.
sloka.hindi: yo:gayuktho: visuddha:thma: vijitha:thma: jithe:ndriyaha | sarvabhu:tha:thma bhu:tha:thma: kurvannapi na lipyathe: || 7
sloka.sanskrit: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः | सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ||५-७||

sloka.english: The yogi who has seen the Truth knows that it is not he that acts whilst seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, walking, sleeping, or breathing,
sloka.hindi: naiva kinchith karo:mi:thi yuktho: manye:tha thaththvavith | pasyan srunvan sprusan jighran asnan gachchan svapan svasan || 8
sloka.sanskrit: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् | पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ||५-८||

sloka.english: Talking, letting go, holding fast, opening or closing the eyes - in the conviction that is the senses that are moving in their respective spheres.
sloka.hindi: pralapan visrujan grunhan unmishan nimishannapi | indriya:n i:ndriya:rtthe:shu varthantha ithi dha:rayan || 9
sloka.sanskrit: प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि | इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ||५-९||

sloka.english: He who dedicates his actions to Brahman and performs them without attachment is not smeared by sin, as the lotus-leaf by water.
sloka.hindi: brahmanya:dha:ya karma:ni sangam thyakthva: karo:thi yaha | lipyathe: na sa pa:pe:na padmapathram iva:mbhasa: || 10
sloka.sanskrit: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः | लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ||५-१०||

sloka.english: Only with the body, mind and intellect and also with the senses, do the yogins perform action without attachment for the sake of self-purification.
sloka.hindi: ka:ye:na manasa: budhya: ke:valair indriyair api | yo:ginah karma kurvanthi sangam thyakthva:::thma suddhaye: || 11
sloka.sanskrit: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि | योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ||५-११||

sloka.english: A man of yoga obtains everlasting peace by abandoning the fruit of action; the man ignorant of yoga, selfishly attached to fruit, remains bound.
sloka.hindi: yukthah karmaphalam thyakthva: sa:nthim a:pno:thi naishttiki:m | ayukthah ka:maka:re:na phale:saktho: nibadhyathe: || 12
sloka.sanskrit: युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् | अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ||५-१२||

sloka.english: Renouncing with the mind all actions, the dweller in the body, who is master of himself, rests happily in his city of nine gates, neither doing nor getting anything done.
sloka.hindi: sarvakarma:ni manasa: sannyasya:sthe: sukham vasi: | navadva:re: pure: de:hi: naiva kurvan na ka:rayan || 13
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी | नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ||५-१३||

sloka.english: The Lord creates neither agency nor action for the world; neither does he connect action with its fruit. It is nature that is at work.
sloka.hindi: na karthruthvam na karma:ni lo:kasya srujathi prabhuhu | na karma phala samyo:gam svabha:vas thu pravarthathe: || 14
sloka.sanskrit: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः | न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ||५-१४||

sloka.english: The Lord does not take upon Himself anyone's vice or virtue; it is ignorance that veils knowledge and deludes all creatures.
sloka.hindi: na: daththe: kasyachith pa:pam na chaiva sukrutham vibhuhu | ajna:ne:na:vrutham jna:nam the:na muhyanthi janthavaha || 15
sloka.sanskrit: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः | अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ||५-१५||

sloka.english: But to them whose ignorance is destroyed by the knowledge of Atman, this their knowledge, like the sun, reveals the Supreme.
sloka.hindi: jna:ne:na thu thad ajna:nam ye:sha:m na:sitham a:thmanaha | the:sha:m a:dithyavath jna:nam praka:sayathi thathparam || 16
sloka.sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः | तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ||५-१६||

sloka.english: Those whose intellect is suffused with That, whose self has become one with That, who abide in That, and whose end and aim is that, wipe out their sins with knowledge, and go whence there is no return.
sloka.hindi: thad buddhayas thada:thma:naha thannishtas thath para:yana:ha | gachhanthya punara:vruththim jna:na nirdhu:tha kalmasha:ha || 17
sloka.sanskrit: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः | गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ||५-१७||

sloka.english: The men of Self-realization look with an equal eye on a brahmana possessed of learning and humility, a cow, an elephant, a dog and even a dog-eater.
sloka.hindi: vidya: vinaya sampanne: brahmane: gavi hasthini | suni chaiva svapa:ke: cha panditha:s samadarsinaha || 18
sloka.sanskrit: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि | शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ||५-१८||

sloka.english: In this very body they have conquered the round of birth and death, whose mind is anchored in sameness; for perfect Brahman is same to all, therefore in Brahman they rest.
sloka.hindi: ihaiva thair jithas sargo: ye:sha:m sa:mye: stthitham manaha | nirdo:sham hi samam bramha thasma:th brahmani the: stthitha:ha || 19
sloka.sanskrit: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः | निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ||५-१९||

sloka.english: He whose understanding is secure, who is undeluded, who knows Brahman and who rests in Brahman, will neither be glad to get what is pleasant, nor sad to get what is unpleasant.
sloka.hindi: na prahrushye:th priyam pra:pya no: dvije:th pra:pya cha:priyam | stthirabuddhir asammu:ddo: brahmavith brahmani stthithaha || 20
sloka.sanskrit: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् | स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ||५-२०||

sloka.english: He who has detached himself from contacts without, finds bliss in Atman; having achieved union with Brahman he enjoys eternal bliss.
sloka.hindi: ba:hya sparse:sh vasaktha:thma: vindath ya:thmani yas sukham | sa bramhayo:ga yuktha:thma: sukham akshayam asnuthe: || 21
sloka.sanskrit: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् | स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ||५-२१||

sloka.english: For the joys derived from sense-contacts are nothing but mines of misery; they have beginning and end, O Kaunteya; the wise man does not revel therein.
sloka.hindi: ye:hi samsparsaja:h bho:ga:ha duhkhayo:naya e:va the: | a:dyanthavanthah kaunthe:ya! na the:shu ramathe: budhaha || 22
sloka.sanskrit: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते | आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ||५-२२||

sloka.english: The man who is able even here on earth, ere he is released from the body, to hold out against the floodtide of lust and wrath, - he is a yogi, he is happy.
sloka.hindi: sakno:thi:haiva yas so:ddum pra:k sari:ra vimo:kshana:th | ka:makro:dho:dbhavam ve:gam sa yukthas sa sukhi: naraha || 23
sloka.sanskrit: शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् | कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ||५-२३||

sloka.english: He who finds happiness only within, rest only within, light only within, - that yogi, having become one with nature, attains to oneness with Brahman.
sloka.hindi: yo::nthas sukho::nthar a:ra:maha thattha:nthar jy:othir e:va yaha | sa yo:gi: brahma nirva:nam brahmabhu:tho::dhi gachhathi || 24
sloka.sanskrit: योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः | स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ||५-२४||

sloka.english: They win oneness with Brahman - the seers whose sins are wiped out, whose doubts are resolved, who have mastered themselves, and who are engrossed in the welfare of all beings.
sloka.hindi: labhanthe:brahma nirva:nam rushayah kshi:na kalmashaha | chhinnadvaidha: yatha:thma:naha sarvabhu:tha hithe: ratha:ha || 25
sloka.sanskrit: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः | छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||५-२५||

sloka.english: Rid of lust and wrath, masters of themselves, the ascetics who have realized Atman find oneness with Brahman everywhere around them.
sloka.hindi: ka:makro:dha viyuktha:na:m yathi:na:m yathache:thasa:m | abhitho: bramha nirva:nam varthathe: vijitha:thmana:m || 26
sloka.sanskrit: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् | अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ||५-२६||

sloka.english: That ascetic is ever free who, having shut out the outward sense-contacts, sits with his gaze fixed between the brows, outward and inward breathing in the nostrils made equal;
sloka.hindi: sparsa:n kruthva: bahir ba:hya:n chakshus chaiva:nthare: bhruvo:ho | pra:na:pa:now samow kruthva: na:sa:bhyanthara cha:rinow || 27
sloka.sanskrit: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः | प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ||५-२७||

sloka.english: his senses, mind, and reason held in check; rid of longing, fear and wrath; and intent on Freedom.
sloka.hindi: yathe:ndriya mano:buddhihi munir mo:ksha para:yanaha | vigathe:chha: bhayakro:dho: yas sada: muktha e:va saha || 28
sloka.sanskrit: यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः | विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ||५-२८||

sloka.english: Knowing Me as the Acceptor of sacrifice and austerity, the great Lord of all the worlds, the Friend of all creation, the yogi attains to peace.
sloka.hindi: bho:ktha:ram yajna thapasa:m sarvalo:ka mahe:svaram | suhrudam sarvabhu:tha:na:m jna:thva: mam san:thi mruchhathi || 29
sloka.sanskrit: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् | सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ||५-२९||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: He who performs all obligatory action, without depending on the fruit thereof, is a sannyasin and a yogin - not the man who neglects the sacrificial fire nor he who neglects action.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha ana:srithah karmaphalam ka:ryam karma karo:thi yaha | sa sannya:si: cha yo:gi: cha na niragnir na cha: kriyaha || 1
sloka.sanskrit: अथ षष्ठोऽध्यायः | आत्मसंयमयोगः श्रीभगवानुवाच | अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः | स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||६-१||

sloka.english: What is called sannyasa, know you to be yoga, O Pandava; for none can become a yogin who has not renounced selfish purpose.
sloka.hindi: yam sannya:sam ithi pra:huhu yo:gam tham viddhi pa:ndava! | nah yasanyastha sankalpo: yo:gi: bhavathi kaschana || 2
sloka.sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव | न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||६-२||

sloka.english: For the man who seeks to scale the heights of yoga, action is said to be the means; for the same man, when he has scaled those heights, repose is said to be the means.
sloka.hindi: a:ruruksho:r mune:r yo:gam karma ka:ranam uchyathe: | yo:ga:ru:ddasya thasyaiva samah ka:ranam uchyathe: || 3
sloka.sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते | योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ||६-३||

sloka.english: When a man is not attached either to the objects of sense or to actions and sheds all selfish purpose, then he is said to have scaled the heights of yoga.
sloka.hindi: yada: hi che:ndriya:rthe:shu na karma svanushajjathe: | sarva sankalpa sannya:si: yo:ga:ru:ddas thado:chyathe: || 4
sloka.sanskrit: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते | सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||६-४||

sloka.english: By one's Self should one raise oneself, and not allow oneself to fall; for Atman (Self) alone is the friend of self, and Self alone is self's foe.
sloka.hindi: uddhare:d a:thman a::thma:nam na:thma:nam avasa:daye:th | a:thmaivah ya:thmano: bandhuhu a:thmaiva ripur a:thmanaha || 5
sloka.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् | आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||६-५||

sloka.english: His Self alone is friend, who has conquered himself by his Self: but to him who has not conquered himself and is thus inimical to himself, even his Self behaves as foe.
sloka.hindi: bandhur a:thma:::thmanas thasya ye:na::thma iva:thmana: jithaha | ana:thmanas thu sathruthve: varthe: tha:thma iva sathruvath || 6
sloka.sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः | अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||६-६||

sloka.english: Of him who has conquered himself and who rests in perfect calm the self is completely composed, in cold and heat, in pleasure and pain, in honour and dishonour.
sloka.hindi: jitha:thmanah prasa:nthasya parama:thma: sama:hithaha | si:tho:shna sukha duhkhe:shu thattha: ma:na:va ma:nayo:ho || 7
sloka.sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ||६-७||

sloka.english: The yogin who is filled with the contentment of wisdom and discriminative knowledge, who is firm as a rock, who has mastered his senses, and to whom a clod of earth, a stone and gold are the same, is possessed of yoga.
sloka.hindi: jna:na vijna:na thruptha:thma: ku:tasttho: vijithe:ndriyaha | yuktha ithyuchyathe: yo:gi: sama lo:shta:sma ka:nchanaha || 8
sloka.sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः | युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ||६-८||

sloka.english: He excels who regards alike the boon companion, the friend, the enemy, the stranger, the mediator, the alien and the ally, as also the saint and the sinner.
sloka.hindi: suhrun mithra:r yuda:si:na madhyasttha dve:shya bandhushu | sa:dhushvapi cha pa:pe:shu sama buddhir visishyathe: || 9
sloka.sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु | साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||६-९||

sloka.english: Let the yogi constantly apply his thought to Atman remaining alone in a scheduled place, his mind and body in control, rid of desires and possessions.
sloka.hindi: yogi: yunji:tha sathatham a:thma:nam rahasi stthithaha | e:ka:ki: yathachittha:thma: nira:si:r aparigrahaha || 10
sloka.sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः | एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ||६-१०||

sloka.english: Fixing for himself, in a pure spot, a firm seat, neither too high nor yet too low, covered with kusha grass, thereon a deerskin, and thereon a cloth;
sloka.hindi: suchau de:se: prathishtta:pya stthiram a:sanam a:thmanaha | na:thyuchhritham na:thi ni:cham che:la:jina kuso:ththaram || 11
sloka.sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः | नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ||६-११||

sloka.english: Sitting on that seat, with mind concentrated, the functions of thought and sense of control, he should set himself to the practice of yoga for the sake of self-purification.
sloka.hindi: thathraika:gram manah kruthva yatha chiththe:ndriya kriyaha | upavis ya::sane: yunjya:th yo:gam a:thma visuddhaye: || 12
sloka.sanskrit: तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः | उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ||६-१२||

sloka.english: Keeping himself steady, holding the trunk, the neck and the head in a straight line and motionless, fixing his eye on the tip of his nose, and looking not around.
sloka.hindi: samam ka:yasiro:gri:vam dha:rayannachalam stthiram | sampre:kshya na:sika:gram svam disas cha:n avalo:kayan || 13
sloka.sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः | सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||६-१३||

sloka.english: Tranquil in spirit, free from fear, steadfast in the vow of brahmacharya, holding his mind in control, the yogi should sit, with all his thoughts on Me, absorbed in Me.
sloka.hindi: prasa:ntha:thma: vigathabhi:hi brahmacha:ri vrathe: stthithaha | manas samyamyam achchiththo: yuktha a:si:tha mathparaha || 14
sloka.sanskrit: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः | मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||६-१४||

sloka.english: The yogi, who ever thus, with mind controlled, unites himself to Atman, wins the peace which culminates in Nirvana, the peace that is in Me.
sloka.hindi: yunjanne:vam sada:::thma:nam yo:gi: niyatha ma:nasaha | sa:nthim nirva:na parama:m mathsamsttha:m adhigachhathi || 15
sloka.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः | शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||६-१५||

sloka.english: Yoga is not for him who eats too much, nor for him who fasts too much, neither for him who sleeps too much, nor yet for him who is too wakeful.
sloka.hindi: na:th yasnathas thu yo:go::sthi na chaika:ntha manasnathaha | na cha:thi svapna si:lasya ja:gratho: naivacha:rjuna ! || 16
sloka.sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः | न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||६-१६||

sloka.english: To him who is disciplined in food and recreation, in effort in all activities, and in sleep and waking, yoga (discipline) becomes a relief from all ills.
sloka.hindi: yuktha:ha:ra viha:rasya yuktha che:shtasya karmasu | yuktha svapna:vabo:dha:sya yo:go: bhavathi dukha ha: || 17
sloka.sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु | युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ||६-१७||

sloka.english: When one's thought, completely controlled, rests steadily on only Atman, when one is free from longing for all objects of desire, then one is called a yogin.
sloka.hindi: yada: viniyatham chiththam a:thman ye:va:vathishtta the: | nisspruhas sarvaka:me:bhyo: yuktha ithyuchyathe: thada: || 18
sloka.sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते | निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||६-१८||

sloka.english: As a taper in a windless spot flickers not, even so is a yogin, with his thought controlled, seeking to unite himself with Atman.
sloka.hindi: yattha: di:po: niva:thasttho: ne:ngathe: so:pama: smrutha: | yo:gino: yathachiththasya yunjatho: yo:gam a:thmanaha || 19
sloka.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता | योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ||६-१९||

sloka.english: Where thought curbed by the practice of yoga completely ceases, where a man sits content within himself, Atman having seen Atman;
sloka.hindi: yathro:pa ramathe: chiththam niruddham yo:ga se:vaya: | yathra chaiva::thman a::thma:nam pasyan na:thmani thushyathi || 20
sloka.sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया | यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ||६-२०||

sloka.english: Where he experiences that endless bliss beyond the senses which can be grasped by reason alone; wherein established he swerves not from the Truth;
sloka.hindi: sukham a:thyanthikam yaththath buddhi gra:hyam athi:ndriyam | ve:ththi yathra na chaiva:yam stthithas chalathi thaththva thaha || 21
sloka.sanskrit: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद् बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् | वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ||६-२१||

sloka.english: Where he holds no other gain greater than that which he has gained; and where, securely seated, he is not shaken by any calamity however great;
sloka.hindi: yam labdhva: cha: param la:bham manyathe: na:dhikam thathaha | yasmin stthitho: na duhkhe:na guruna::pi vicha:lyathe: || 22
sloka.sanskrit: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः | यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ||६-२२||

sloka.english: That state should be known as yoga (union with the Supreme), the disunion from all union with pain. This yoga must one practice with firm resolve and unwearying zeal.
sloka.hindi: tham vidya:d duhkha samyo:ga viyo:gam yo:ga samjnitham | sa nichaye:na yo:kthavyo: yo:go::nirvinna che:thasa: || 23
sloka.sanskrit: तं विद्याद् दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् | स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||६-२३||

sloka.english: Shaking oneself completely free from longings born of selfish purpose; reining in the whole host of senses, from all sides, with the mind itself;
sloka.hindi: sankalpa prabhava:n ka:ma:n thyakthva: sarva:n ase:shathaha | manasai ve:ndriya gra:mam viniyamya samantha thaha || 24
sloka.sanskrit: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः | मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ||६-२४||

sloka.english: With reason held securely by the will, he should gradually attain calm and with the mind established in Atman think of nothing.
sloka.hindi: sanais sanair uparame:th buddhya: dhruthi gruhi:thaya: | a:thma samsttham manah kruthva: na kinchid api chinthaye:th || 25
sloka.sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद् बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया | आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||६-२५||

sloka.english: Wherever the fickle and unsteady mind wanders, thence should it be reined and brought under the sole sway of Atman.
sloka.hindi: yatho: yatho: nissarathi manas chanchalam astthiram | thathas thatho: niyamyaithath a:thmanye:va vasam naye:th || 26
sloka.sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् | ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||६-२६||

sloka.english: The yogi whose mind is tranquil With passions calmed, free of evil, Having become one with Brahman, Attains the supreme happiness.
sloka.hindi: prasa:ntha manasam hye:nam yo:ginam sukham uththamam | upaithi sa:ntha rajasam brahma bhu:tham akalmasham || 27
sloka.sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् | उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||६-२७||

sloka.english: The yogin, cleansed of all stain, unites himself ever thus to Atman, easily enjoys the endless bliss of contact with Brahman.
sloka.hindi: e:vam yunjan sada::thma:nam yo:gi: vigatha kalmashaha | sukhe:na bramha samsparsam athyantham sukham asnuthe: || 28
sloka.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः | सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||६-२८||

sloka.english: The man equipped with yoga looks on all with an impartial eye, seeing Atman in all beings and all beings in Atman.
sloka.hindi: sarvabhu:thasttham a:thma:nam sarvabhu:tha:ni cha:thmani | i:kshathe: yoga yuktha:thma: sarvathra samadarsanaha || 29
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि | ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ||६-२९||

sloka.english: He who sees Me everywhere and everything in Me, never vanishes from Me nor I from him.
sloka.hindi: yo: ma:m pasyathi sarvathra sarvam cha mayi pasyathi | thasya:ham na pranasya:mi sa cha me: na pranasyathi || 30
sloka.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति | तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||६-३०||

sloka.english: The yogin who, anchored in unity, worships Me abiding in all beings, lives and moves in me, no matter how he live and move.
sloka.hindi: sarva bhu:tha stthitham yo: ma:m bhajath ye:kathvam a:stthithaha | sarvattha: varthama:no:: pi sa yo:gi: mayi varthathe: || 31
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||६-३१||

sloka.english: He who, by likening himself with others, senses pleasure and pain equally for all as for himself, is deemed to be the highest yogi, O Arjuna.
sloka.hindi: a:thmaupamye:na sarvathra samam pasyathi yo:rjuna! | sukham va: yadi va: duhkham sa yo:gi: paramo: mathaha || 32
sloka.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन | सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||६-३२||

sloka.english: Arjuna Said: I do not see, O Madhusudana, how this yoga, based on the equal-mindedness that you have expounded to me, can steadily endure, because of fickleness (of the mind).
sloka.hindi: arjuna uva:cha yo:: yam yo:gas thvaya: pro:kthaha sa:mye:na madhu su:dana! | e:thas ya:ham na pasya:mi chanchala thva:th stthithim stthira:m || 33
sloka.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन | एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||६-३३||

sloka.english: For fickle is the mind, O Krishna, unruly, overpowering and stubborn; to curb it is, I think, as hard as to curb the wind.
sloka.hindi: chanchalam hi manah krushna! prama:dhi balavad druddam | thasya:ham nigraham manye: va:yo:riva sudushkaram || 34
sloka.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् | तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||६-३४||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Undoubtedly, O Mahabahu, the mind is fickle and hard to curb; yet, O Kaunteya, it can be held in check by constant practice and dispassion.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha asamsayam maha:ba:ho:! mano: durnigraham chalam | abhya:se:na thu kaunthe:ya! vaira:gye:na cha gruhyathe: || 35
sloka.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् | अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||६-३५||

sloka.english: Without self-restraint, yoga, I hold, is difficult to attain; but the self-governed soul can attain it by proper means, if he strives for it.
sloka.hindi: asamyath a:thmana: yo:go: dushpra:pa ithi me: mathihi | vasya:thmana: thu yathatha: sakyo:: va:pthum upa:yathaha || 36
sloka.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः | वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ||६-३६||

sloka.english: Arjuna Said: O Krishna! If one, possessed of faith, but slack of effort, because of his mind straying from yoga, reach not perfection in yoga, what end does he come to
sloka.hindi: arjuna uva:cha ayathi sraddhayo: pe:tho: yo:ga:ch chalitha ma:nasaha | apra:pya yo:ga samsiddhim k:am gathim krushna! gachhathi || 37
sloka.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः | अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||६-३७||

sloka.english: Without a foothold, and floundering in the path to Brahman fallen from both, is he indeed not lost, O Mahabahu, like a dissipated cloud?
sloka.hindi: kachchin no:bhaya vibhrashtaha chhinna:bhram iva nasyathi | aprathistto: maha:ba:ho:! vimu:ddo: bramhanah patthi || 38
sloka.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति | अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||६-३८||

sloka.english: O Krishna! only you can dispel my doubt. For there is to be found none other than you to banish this doubt.
sloka.hindi: e:tham me: samsayam krushna! chhe:ththum arhas yase:shathaha | thvadanyas samsaya sya:sya chheththa: nah yupapadyathe: || 39
sloka.sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः | त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||६-३९||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Neither in this world, nor in the next, can there be ruin for him, O Partha; no well-doer, oh loved one, meets with a sad end.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha pa:rttha naive:ha na::muthra vina:sas thasya vidyathe: | na hi kalyanakruth kaschith durgathim tha:tha! gachhathi || 40
sloka.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते | न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद् दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||६-४०||

sloka.english: Fallen from yoga, a man attains the worlds of righteous souls, and having dwelt there for numberless years is then born in a house of pure and gentle blood.
sloka.hindi: pra:pya punya krutha:m lo:ka:n ushithva: sa:svathi:s sama:ha | suchi:na:m sri:matha:m ge:he: yo:ga bhrashto:: bhija:yathe: || 41
sloka.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः | शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ||६-४१||

sloka.english: Or he may even be born into a family of yogins, though such birth as this is all too rare in this world.
sloka.hindi: atthava: yo:gina:m e:va kule: bhavathi dhi:matha:m | e:thaddhi durlabhatharam lo:ke: janma yadi:drusam || 42
sloka.sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् | एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||६-४२||

sloka.english: There, O Kurunandana, he discovers the intellectual stage he had reached in previous birth, and thence he stretches forward again towards perfection.
sloka.hindi: thathra tham buddhi samyo:gam labhathe: paurvadaihikam | yathathe: cha thatho: bhu:yaha samsiddhow kuru nandana! || 43
sloka.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् | यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||६-४३||

sloka.english: By virtue of that previous practice he is borne on, whether he will it or not, even he with a desire to know yoga passes beyond the Vedic ritual.
sloka.hindi: pu:rva:bhya:se:na the:naiva hriyathe: hyavaso::pi saha | jijna:sur api yo:gasya sabda bramha:thi varthathe: || 44
sloka.sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः | जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||६-४४||

sloka.english: But the yogi who perseveres in his striving, cleansed of sin, perfected through many births, reaches the highest state.
sloka.hindi: prayathna:d yathama:nasthu yo:gi: samsuddha kilbishaha | ane:ka janma samsiddhaha thatho: ya:thi para:m gathim || 45
sloka.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः | अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||६-४५||

sloka.english: The yogin is deemed higher than the man of austerities; he is deemed also higher than the man of knowledge; higher is he than the man engrossed in ritual; therefore be you a yogin, O Arjuna!
sloka.hindi: thapasvibh yo::dhiko: yo:gi: jna:nibhyo:: pi matho::dhikaha | karmibhyas cha:dhiko: yo:gi: thasmad yo:gi: bhava:rjuna! || 46
sloka.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः | कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ||६-४६||

sloka.english: And among all yogins, he who worships Me with faith, his inmost self all rapt in Me, is deemed by me to be the best yogin.
sloka.hindi: yo:gina:m api sarve:sha:m madgathe: na:nthara:thmana: | sraddha:va:n bhajathe: yo: ma:m sa me: yukthathamo: mathaha || 47
sloka.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना | श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||६-४७||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Hear, O Partha, how, with thy mind rivetted on me, by practicing yoga and making me the sole refuge, you shall, without doubt, know me fully.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha mayya: saktha mana:h pa:rttha! yo:gam yunjan mada:srayaha| asamsayam samagram ma:m yattha: jna:syasi thachhrunu || 01
sloka.sanskrit: अथ सप्तमोऽध्यायः | ज्ञानविज्ञानयोगः श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः | असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||७-१||

sloka.english: I will declare to thee, in its entirety, this knowledge, combined with discriminative knowledge, which when you have known there remains here nothing more to be known.
sloka.hindi: jna:nam the::ham savijna:nam idam vakshyam yase:shathaha| yath jna:thva: ne:ha bhu:yo::nyath jna:thavyam avasishyathe: || 02
sloka.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः | यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||७-२||

sloka.english: Among thousands of men hardly one strives after perfection; among those who strive hardly one knows Me in truth.
sloka.hindi: manushya:na:m sahasre:shu kaschid yathathi siddhaye: | yathatha:m api siddha:na:m kaschin ma:m ve:ththi thathvathaha|| 03
sloka.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये | यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ||७-३||

sloka.english: Earth, Water, Fire, Air, Ether, Mind, Reason and Ego - thus eightfold is my prakriti divided.
sloka.hindi: bhu:mi ra:po::nalo: va:yuhu kham mano: budhir e:va cha| ahamka:ra ithi:yam me: bhinna: prakruthir ashtadha:|| 04
sloka.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च | अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||७-४||

sloka.english: This is My lower aspect; but know you My other aspect, the higher - which is Jiva (the Vital Essence) by which, O Mahabahu, this world is sustained.
sloka.hindi: apare:yam, ithasth wanya:m prakruthim viddhi me: para:m| ji:va bhu:tha:m maha:ba:ho! yaye:dam dha:ryathe: jagath|| 05
sloka.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् | जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||७-५||

sloka.english: Know that these two compose the source from which all beings spring; I am the origin and end of the entire universe.
sloka.hindi: e:thadyo:ni:ni bhu:tha:ni sarva:ni:th yupadha:raya| aham kruthsnasya jagathaha prabhavah pralayas thattha:|| 06
sloka.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय | अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ||७-६||

sloka.english: There is nothing higher than I, O Dhananjaya; all this is strung on Me as a row of gems upon a thread.
sloka.hindi: maththah paratharam na:nyath kimchid asthi dhananjaya!| mayi sarvam idam pro:tham su:thre: manigana: iva || 07
sloka.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय | मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||७-७||

sloka.english: In water I am the savour, O Kaunteya; in the sun and the moon I am the light; the syllable AUM in all the Vedas; the sound in ether, and manliness in men.
sloka.hindi: raso::ham apsu kounthe:ya ! prabha::smi sasi su:ryayo:ho| pranavas sarva ve:de:shu sabdah khe: pourusham nrushu || 08
sloka.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः | प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||७-८||

sloka.english: I am the sweet fragrance in earth; the brilliance in fire; the life in all beings; and the austerity in ascetics.
sloka.hindi: punyo: gandhah prutthivya:m cha the:jas cha:smi vibha:vasow | ji:vanam sarva bhu:the:shu thapascha:smi thapasvishu|| 09
sloka.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ | जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||७-९||

sloka.english: Know Me, O Partha, to be the primeval seed of all beings; I am the reason of rational beings and the splendour of the splendid.
sloka.hindi: bi:jam ma:m sarva bhu:tha:na:m viddhi pa:rttha! sana:thanam| buddhir buddhi matha:m asmi the:jas the:jasvina:m aham|| 10
sloka.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् | बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||७-१०||

sloka.english: Of the strong, I am the strength, divorced from lust and passion; in beings I am desire undivorced from righteousness.
sloka.hindi: balam balavatha:m cha:ham ka:ma ra:ga vivarjitham | dharma: viruddho:bhu:the:shu kamo::smi bharatharshabha !|| 11
sloka.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् | धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||७-११||

sloka.english: Know that all the manifestations of the three gunas, sattva, rajas, and tamas, proceed from none but Me; yet I am not in them; they are in Me.
sloka.hindi: ye:chaiva sa:thvika: bha:va:ha ra:jasa:s tha:masa:s cha ye:| maththa e:ve:thi tha:n viddhi na thvaham the:shu the: mayi|| 12
sloka.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये | मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||७-१२||

sloka.english: Befogged by these manifestations of the three gunas, the entire world fails to recognize Me, the imperishable, as transcending them.
sloka.hindi: thribhir guna mayair bha:vaih e:bhis sarvam idam jagath | mohitham na:bhi ja:na:thi ma:me:bhyah param avyayam|| 13
sloka.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् | मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ||७-१३||

sloka.english: For this My divine delusive mystery made up of the three gunas is hard to pierce; but those who make Me their sole refuge pierce the veil.
sloka.hindi: daivi: hye:sha gunamayi: mama ma:ya: durathyaya:| ma:me:va ye:prapadyanthe: ma:ya:m e:tha:m tharanthi the:|| 14
sloka.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया | मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||७-१४||

sloka.english: The deluded evil-doers, lowest of men, do not see refuge in Me; for, by reason of this delusive mystery, they are bereft of knowledge and given to devilish ways.
sloka.hindi: nama:m dushkruthino: mu:dda:h prapadyanthe: nara:dhama:ha | ma:ya ya:pahutha jna:na:ha a:suram bha:vam a:sritha:ha|| 15
sloka.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः | माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ||७-१५||

sloka.english: Four types of well-doers are devoted to Me, O Arjuna; they are, O Bharatarshabha, the afflicted, the spiritual seeker, the material seeker, and the enlightened.
sloka.hindi: chathurvidha: bhajanthe: ma:m jana:ha suskruthino::rjuna ! | a:rtho: jijna:sur arttha:rtthi: jna:ne: cha bharatharshabha || 16
sloka.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन | आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||७-१६||

sloka.english: Of these the enlightened, ever attached to Me in single-minded devotion, is the best; for to the enlightened I am exceedingly dear and he is dear to Me.
sloka.hindi: the:sha:m jna:ni: nithyayukthaha e:kabhakthir visishyathe: | priyo:hi jnanino: thyardham aham sa cha mama priyaha|| 17
sloka.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते | प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||७-१७||

sloka.english: All these are estimable indeed, but the enlightened I hold to be My very self; for he, the true yogi, is stayed on Me alone, the supreme goal.
sloka.hindi: uda:ra:s sarva e:vaithe: jna:ni:th va:thma iva me: matham| astthithas sahi yuktha:thma: mame:va:n uthama:m gathim || 18
sloka.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् | आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||७-१८||

sloka.english: At the end of many births the enlightened man finds refuge in Me; rare indeed is this great soul to whom 'Vasudeva is all'.
sloka.hindi: bahu:na:m janmana:m anthe: jna:nava:n ma:m prapadyathe: | va:sude:vas sarvam ithi sa maha:thma: sudurlabhaha || 19
sloka.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते | वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ||७-१९||

sloka.english: Men, bereft of knowledge by reason of various longings, seek refuge in other gods, pinning their faith on diverse rites, guided by their own nature.
sloka.hindi: ka:mai sthai sthair hrutha jna:na:ha prapadyanthe::nya de:vatha:ha | tham tham niyamam a:sthha:ya prakruthya: niyatha:s svaya: || 20
sloka.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः | तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||७-२०||

sloka.english: Whatever form one desires to worship in faith and devotion, in that very form I make that faith of his secure.
sloka.hindi: yo: yo: ya:m ya:m thanum bhakthaha sraddhaya::rchithum ichchathi| thasya thasya:chala:m sraddha:m tha:m e:va vidadha:myaham || 21
sloka.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति | तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||७-२१||

sloka.english: Possessed of that faith he seeks a propitiate that one, and obtains therethrough his longings, dispensed in truth by none but Me.
sloka.hindi: sa thaya: sraddhaya: yukthaha thasya:ra:dhanami:hathe: | labhathe: cha thathah ka:ma:n mayaiva vihitha:n hi tha:n || 22
sloka.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते | लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||७-२२||

sloka.english: But limited is the fruit that falls to those shortsighted ones; those who worship the gods go to the gods, those who worship Me come unto Me.
sloka.hindi: anthavaththu phalam the:sha:m thad bhavathalpa me:dhasa:m | de:va:n de:vayajo: ya:nthi madbhaktha: ya:nthi ma:m api || 23
sloka.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् | देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||७-२३||

sloka.english: Not knowing My transcendent, imperishable, supreme character, the undiscerning think Me who am unmanifest to have become manifest.
sloka.hindi: avyaktham vyakthim a:pannam manyanthe: ma: m abuddhayaha| param bha:vam aja:nantho: mama:: vyayam anuththamam|| 24
sloka.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः | परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ||७-२४||

sloka.english: Veiled by the delusive mystery created by My unique power, I am not manifest to all; this bewildered world does not recognize Me, birthless and changeless.
sloka.hindi: na::ham praka:sas sarvasya yo:gama:ya: sama:vruthaha| mu:ddo::yam na::bhi ja:na:thi lo:ko: ma:majam avyayam|| 25
sloka.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः | मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||७-२५||

sloka.english: I know, O Arjuna, all creatures past, present and to be; but no one knows Me.
sloka.hindi: ve:da::ham samathi:tha:ni varthama:na:ni cha:rjuna! | bhavishya:ni cha bhu:tha:ni ma:m thu ve:da na kaschana || 26
sloka.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन | भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||७-२६||

sloka.english: All creatures in this universe are bewildered, O Parantapa, by virtue of the delusion of the pairs of opposite sprung from likes and dislikes, O Bharata.
sloka.hindi: ichha: dve:sha samutthe:na dvandva mo:he:na bharatha!| sarvabhu:tha:ni sammo:ham sarge: ya:nthi paranthapa!|| 27
sloka.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत | सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||७-२७||

sloka.english: But those virtuous men whose sin has come to an end, freed from delusion and of the pairs of opposites, worship Me in steadfast faith.
sloka.hindi: e:sha:m thvanthagatham pa:pam jana:na:m punya karmana:m the: dvandva mo:ha nirmuktha: bhajanthe: ma:m druddavratha:ha || 28
sloka.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् | ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ||७-२८||

sloka.english: Those who endeavour for freedom from age and death by taking refuge in Me, know in full that Brahman, Adhyatma and all Karma.
sloka.hindi: jara: marana mo:ksha:ya ma:m a:srithya yathanthi ye: | the: bramha thadviduhu kruthsnam adh:ya:thmam karma cha:khilam|| 29
sloka.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये | ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||७-२९||

sloka.english: Those who know Me, including Adhibhuta, Adhidaiva, Adhiyajna, possessed of even-mindedness, they know Me even at the time of passing away.
sloka.hindi: sa:dhi bhu:tha:dhi daivam ma:m sa:dhi yajnam cha ye: viduhu | praya:naka:le::pi cha ma:m the: vidur yuktha che:thasaha|| 30
sloka.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः | प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ||७-३०||

sloka.english: Arjuna Said: What is that Brahman? What is Adhyatma? What Karma, O Purushottama? What is called Adhibhuta? And what Adhidaiva?
sloka.hindi: arjuna uva:cha kim thath brahma? kim adhya:thmam? kim karma? purusho:ththama!| adhibhu:tham cha kim pro:ktham? adhi daivam kim uchyathe:?|| 1
sloka.sanskrit: अथ अष्टमोऽध्यायः | अक्षरब्रह्मयोगः अर्जुन उवाच | किं तद् ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम | अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ||८-१||

sloka.english: And who here in this body is Adhiyajna and how? And how at the time of death art you to be known by the self-controlled?
sloka.hindi: adhiyajnah kattham ko::thra de:he::smin madhu su:dana ! | praya:na ka:le: cha kattham jne:yo::si niyath a:thmabhihi || 2
sloka.sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन | प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ||८-२||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: The Supreme, the Imperishable is Brahman; its manifestation is Adhyatma; the creative process whereby all beings are created is called Karma.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha aksharam bramha paramam swabha:vo::dhya:thmam uchyathe: | bhu:tha bha:vo:dbhava karo: visargah karma samjnithaha || 3
sloka.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते | भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ||८-३||

sloka.english: Adhibhuta is My perishable form; Adhidaivata is the individual self in that form; and O best among the embodied, Adhiyajna am I in this body, purified by sacrifice.
sloka.hindi: adhi bhu:tham ksharo: bha:vah purushas cha:dhi daivatham | adhi yajno:: ham e:va::thra de:he: de:ha bhrutha:m vara || 4
sloka.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् | अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ||८-४||

sloka.english: And he who, at the last hour remembering Me only, departs leaving the body, enters into Me; of that there is no doubt.
sloka.hindi: antha ka:le:cha ma:me:va smaran mukthva: kale:baram | yah praya:thi sa madbha:vam ya:thi na:sth yathra samsayaha || 5
sloka.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् | यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ||८-५||

sloka.english: Or whatever form a man continually contemplates, that same he remembers in the hour of death, and to that very form he goes, O Kaunteya.
sloka.hindi: yam yam va::pi smaran bha:vam thyaja thyanthe: kale:baram | tham thame: vaithi kounthe:ya! sada: thad bha:va bha:vithaha || 6
sloka.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् | तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ||८-६||

sloka.english: Therefore at all times remember Me and fight on; thy mind and reason thus on Me fixed you shall surely come to Me.
sloka.hindi: thasma:th sarve:shu ka:le:shu ma:m anusmara yuddhya cha ! | mayyarpitha mano: buddhihi ma:me: vaishyas yasamsayaha|| 7
sloka.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च | मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः ||८-७||

sloka.english: With thought steadied by constant practice, and wandering nowhere, he who meditates on the Supreme Celestial Being, O Partha, goes to Him.
sloka.hindi: abhya:sa yo:ga yukthe:na che:thasa: na:nya ga:mina: paramam purusham divyam ya:thi parttha: nuchinthayan|| 8
sloka.sanskrit: orसंशयम् अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना | परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ||८-८||

sloka.english: One meditates on the omniscient, primordial, the controller, smaller than the atom, yet the maintainer of everything; whose form is inconceivable, resplendent like the sun and totally transcendental to the material nature.
sloka.hindi: kavim pura:nam anusa:sitha:ram ano:rani:ya:msam anusmare:dyaha | sarvasya dha:tha:ram achinthya ru:pam adithya varnam thamasah parastha:th || 9
sloka.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितार- मणोरणीयंसमनुस्मरेद्यः | सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप- मादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ||८-९||

sloka.english: One who at the moment of death with an undeviating mind, by the power of the science of uniting the individual consciousness with the Ultimate Consciousness, engaged in the devotional service, properly establishes the life breath between the eyebrows and achieves the effulgent, Supreme Personality.
sloka.hindi: praya:na ka:le: manasa::chale:na bhakthya: yuktho: yo:ga bale:na chaiva bhruvo:r madhye: pra:nam a:ve:sya samyak sa tham param purusham upaithi divyam || 10
sloka.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव | भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ||८-१०||

sloka.english: That which the knowers of the Vedas call the Imperishable (or that word which the knowers of the Vedas repeat), wherein the ascetics freed from passion enter and desiring which they practice brahmacharya, that Goal (or Word) I will declare to thee in brief.
sloka.hindi: yadaksharam ve:davido: vadanthi visanthi yadyathayo: vi:tha ra:ga:ha | yad ichhantho: bramhacharyam charanthi thath the: padam samgrahe:na pravakshye: || 11
sloka.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः | यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ||८-११||

sloka.english: Closing all the gates, locking up the mind in the hridaya, fixing his breath within the head, rapt in yogic meditation;
sloka.hindi: sarva dwara:ni samyamya mono: hrudi nirudhya cha | mu:rdhnya:dha: ya:thmanah pra:nam a:sthhitho: yo:ga dha:rana:m || 12
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च | मूध्न्यार्धायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ||८-१२||

sloka.english: Whoso departs leaving the body uttering AUM - Brahman in one syllable - repeatedly thinking on Me, he reaches the highest state.
sloka.hindi: o:m ithye:kasharam bramha vya:haran ma:m anusmaran | yah praya:thi thyajan de:ham saya:thi parama:m gathim || 13
sloka.sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् | यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ||८-१३||

sloka.english: That yogi easily wins to Me, O Partha, who, ever attached to Me, constantly remembers Me with undivided mind.
sloka.hindi: ananya che:tha:s sathatham yo: ma:m smarathi nithyasaha | thasya:ham sulabhah pa:rttha ! nithya yukthasya yo:ginaha || 14
sloka.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः | तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ||८-१४||

sloka.english: Great souls, having come to Me, reach the highest perfection; they come not again to birth, unlasting and (withal) an abode of misery.
sloka.hindi: ma:m upe:thya punarjanma duhkha:layam asa:svatham | na:pnuvanthi maha:th ma:naha sam siddhim parama:m gatha:ha || 15
sloka.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् | नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ||८-१५||

sloka.english: From the world of Brahma down, all the worlds are subject to return, O Arjuna; but on coming to Me there is no rebirth.
sloka.hindi: a:bramha bhuvan:al lo:ka:ha punar a:varthino::rjuna! | ma:m upe:thya thu kounthe:ya ! punarjanma na vidyathe: || 16
sloka.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन | मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ||८-१६||

sloka.english: Those men indeed know what is Day and what is Night, who know that Brahma's day lasts a thousand yugas and that his night too is a thousand yugas long.
sloka.hindi: sahasra yuga paryantham aharyad bramhano: viduhu | ra:thrim yuga sahasra:ntha:m the::ho: ra:thra vido: jana:ha || 17
sloka.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद् ब्रह्मणो विदुः | रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ||८-१७||

sloka.english: At the coming of Day all the manifest spring forth from the Unmanifest, and at the coming of Night they are dissolved into that same Unmanifest.
sloka.hindi: avyaktha:d vyakthayas sarva:h prabhavanthyaha ra:game: | rathrya:game: prali:yanthe: thathraiva:vyaktha samjnake: || 18
sloka.sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद् व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे | रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ||८-१८||

sloka.english: This same multitude of creatures come to birth, O Partha, again and again; they are dissolved at the coming of Night, whether they will or not; and at the break of Day they are re-born.
sloka.hindi: bhu:tha gra:mas sa e:va::yam bhu:thva: bhu:thva: prali:yathe:| ra:thrya:game:: vasah pa:rttha! prabhavath yaha ra:game: || 19
sloka.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते | रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ||८-१९||

sloka.english: But higher than the Unmanifest is another Unmanifest Being, everlasting, which perisheth not when all creatures perish.
sloka.hindi: paras thasma:ththu bha:vo:: nyo: vyaktho::vyaktha:th sana:thanaha | yas sa sarve:shu bhu:the:shu nasyathsu na vinasyathi || 20
sloka.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः | यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ||८-२०||

sloka.english: This Unmanifest, named the Imperishable, is declared to be the highest goal. For those who reach it there is no return. That is my highest abode.
sloka.hindi: avyaktho::kshara ithyukthaha tham a:huhu parama:m gathim | yam pra:pya na nivarthanthe: thaddha:ma paramam mama || 21
sloka.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् | यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ||८-२१||

sloka.english: This Supreme Being, O Partha, may be won by undivided devotion; in It all beings dwell, by It all is pervaded.
sloka.hindi: purushas sa parah pa:rttha! bhakthya: labhyasthvan anyaya: | yasya:nthasttha:ni bhu:tha:ni ye:na sarvam idam thatham || 22
sloka.sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया | यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ||८-२२||

sloka.english: Now I will tell thee, Bharatarshabha, the conditions which determine the exemption from return, as also the return, of yogins after they pass away hence.
sloka.hindi: yathra ka:le:thvana: vrutthim a:vrutthim chaiva yo:ginaha | praya:tha: ya:nthi tham ka:lam vakshya:mi bharatharshabha! || 23
sloka.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः | प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ||८-२३||

sloka.english: Fire, Light, Day, the Bright Fortnight, the six months of the Northern Solstice - through these departing men knowing Brahman go to Brahman.
sloka.hindi: agnir jyo:thir ahas suklaha shan ma:sa: uththara:yanam | thathra praya:tha: gachhanthi bramha bramhavido: jana:ha || 24
sloka.sanskrit: अग्निर्जोतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् | तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ||८-२४||

sloka.english: Smoke, Night, the Dark Fortnight, the six months of the Southern Solstice - Therethrough the yogin attains to the lunar light and thence returns.
sloka.hindi: dhu:mo:rathris thattha: krishnaha shanma:sa: dakshina:yanam | thathra cha:ndra ma:sam jyo:thihi yogi: pra:pya nivarthathe: || 25
sloka.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् | तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ||८-२५||

sloka.english: These two paths - bright and dark - are deemed to be the eternal paths of the world; by the one a man goes to return not, by the other he returns again.
sloka.hindi: sukla krishne: gathi:h ye:the: jagathas sasvathe: mathe: | e:kaya: ya:thyana:vrutthim anyaya::: varthathe: punaha || 26
sloka.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते | एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ||८-२६||

sloka.english: The Yogin knowing these two paths falls not into delusion, O Partha; therefore, at all times, O Arjuna, remain steadfast in yoga.
sloka.hindi: naithe: sruthi: parttha ! ja:nan yo:gi: muhyathi kaschana | thasma:th sarve:shu ka:le:shu yo:ga yoktho: bhava:rjuna! || 27
sloka.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन | तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ||८-२७||

sloka.english: Whatever fruit of good deeds is laid down as accruing from (a study of) the Vedas, from sacrifices, austerities, and acts of charity - all that the yogin transcends, on knowing this, and reaches the Supreme and Primal Abode.
sloka.hindi: ve:de:shu yajne:shu thapas su chaiva da:ne:shu yath punya phalam pradishtam | athye:thi thath sarvam idam vidithva: yogi: param sttha:nam upaithi cha:dyam || 28
sloka.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् | अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ||८-२८||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: I will now declare to thee, who art uncensorious, this mysterious knowledge, together with discriminative knowledge, knowing which you shall be released from ill.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagva:n uva:cha idam thu the: guhya thamam pravaksha:m yanasu:yave: | jna:nam vijna:na sahitham yad jna:thava: mokshase::subha:th || 1
sloka.sanskrit: अथ नवमोऽध्यायः | राजविद्याराजगुह्ययोगः श्रीभगवानुवाच | इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे | ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||९-१||

sloka.english: This is the king of sciences, the king of mysteries, pure and sovereign, capable of direct comprehension, the essence of dharma, easy to practice, changeless.
sloka.hindi: ra:ja vidya: ra:ja guhyam pavithram idam uththamam | prathyaksha: vagamam dharmayam susukham karthum avyayam || 2
sloka.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् | प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ||९-२||

sloka.english: Men who have no faith in this doctrine, O Parantapa, far from coming to Me, return repeatedly to the path of this world of death.
sloka.hindi: a:sraddha dha:na:h purusha:ha dharmasya: sya paramthapa ! | apra:pya ma:m nivarthanthe: mruthyu samsa:ra varthmani || 3
sloka.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप | अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ||९-३||

sloka.english: By Me, unmanifest in form, this whole world is pervaded; all beings are in Me, I am not in them.
sloka.hindi: maya: thatham idam sarvam jagad avyaktha mu:rthina: | mathsttha:ni sarva bhu:tha:ni na cha:ham the:shv avastthithaha || 4
sloka.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना | मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ||९-४||

sloka.english: And yet those beings are not in Me. That indeed is My unique power as Lord! Sustainer of all beings, I am not in them; My Self brings them into existence.
sloka.hindi: na cha mathsttha:ni bhu:tha:ni pasya me: yo:gam aisvaram | bhu:thabhrun na cha bhuthasttho: mama:thma: bhu:tha bha:vanaha || 5
sloka.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् | भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ||९-५||

sloka.english: As the mighty wind, moving everywhere, is ever contained in ether, even so know that all beings are contained in Me.
sloka.hindi: yattha:ka:sa stthitho: nithyam va:yus sarvathrago: maha:n | thattha: sarva:ni bhutha:ni math sttha:ni: th yupa dha:raya || 6
sloka.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् | तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ||९-६||

sloka.english: All beings, O Kaunteya, merge into my prakriti, at the end of a kalpa, and I send them forth again when a kalpa begins.
sloka.hindi: sarva bhu:tha:ni kaunthe:ya ! prakruthim ya:nthi ma:mika:m | kalpakshaye: punas tha:ni kalpa:dow visruja:m yaham || 7
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् | कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ||९-७||

sloka.english: Resorting to my prakriti, I send forth again and again this multitude of beings, powerless under the sway of prakriti.
sloka.hindi: prakruthim sva:m avastabhya visruja:mi punah punaha | bhu:tha gra:mam imam kruthsnam avasam prakurthe:r vasa:th || 8
sloka.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः | भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ||९-८||

sloka.english: But all this activity, O Dhananjaya, does not bind Me, seated as one indifferent, unattached to it.
sloka.hindi: na cha ma:m tha:ni karma:ni nibadhnanthi dhanamjaya | uda:si:navad a:si:nam asaktham the:shu karmasu || 9
sloka.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय | उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ||९-९||

sloka.english: With me as Presiding Witness, prakriti gives birth to all that moves and does not move; and because of this, O Kaunteya, the wheel of the world keeps going.
sloka.hindi: maya::dhyakshe:na prakruthihi su:yathe sa chara:charam | he:thuna::ne:na kaunthe:ya jagaddhi parivarthathe: || 10
sloka.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् | हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ||९-१०||

sloka.english: Not knowing My transcendent nature as the sovereign Lord of all beings, fools condemn Me incarnated as man.
sloka.hindi: avaja:nanthi ma:m mu:dda:ha ma:nushi:m thanum a:sritham | param bha:vam aja:nantho: mama bhu:tha mahesvaram || 11
sloka.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् | परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ||९-११||

sloka.english: Vain are the hopes, actions and knowledge of those witless ones who have resorted to the delusive nature of monsters and devils.
sloka.hindi: mogha:sa: mo:ghakarma:no: mo:gha jna:na: viche:thasaha | ra:kshasi:m a:suri:m chaiva prakruthim mohini:m sritha:ha || 12
sloka.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः | राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ||९-१२||

sloka.english: But those great souls who resort to the divine nature, O Partha, know Me as the Imperishable Source of all beings and worship Me with an undivided mind.
sloka.hindi: maha:thma:nas thu ma:m pa:rttha ! daivi:m prakruthim a:sritha:ha | bhaja:nth yananya manaso: jna:thva: bhu:tha:dim avyayam || 13
sloka.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः | भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ||९-१३||

sloka.english: Always declaring My glory, striving in steadfast faith, they do Me devout homage; ever attached to Me, they worship Me.
sloka.hindi: sathatham ki:rthayantho: ma:m yathanthas cha drudda vratha:ha | namasyanthas cha ma:m bhakthya: nithya yuktha: upa:sathe: || 14
sloka.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः | नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ||९-१४||

sloka.english: Yet others, with knowledge-sacrifice, worship Me, who am to be seen everywhere, as one, as different or as many.
sloka.hindi: jna:nayajne:na cha:pyanye: yajantho: ma:m upa:sathe: | e:kathve:na prutthakthve:na bahuttha: visvatho:mukham || 15
sloka.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते | एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ||९-१५||

sloka.english: I am the sacrificial vow; I am the sacrifice; I the ancestral oblation; I the herb; I the sacred text; I the clarified butter; I the fire; I the burnt offering.
sloka.hindi: aham krathur aham yajnaha svadha:ham aham owshadham | manthro:ham ahame:va:jyam aham agnir aham hutham || 16
sloka.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् | मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ||९-१६||

sloka.english: Of this universe I am the Father, Mother, Creator, Grandsire: I am what is to be known, the sacred syllable AUM; the rig, the Saman and the Yajus;
sloka.hindi: pitha::ham asya jagatho: ma:tha: dhatha: pitha:mahaha | ve:dyam pavithram omka:raha ruk sa:ma yajur e:va cha || 17
sloka.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः | वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ||९-१७||

sloka.english: I am the Goal, the Sustainer, the Lord, the Witness, the Abode, the Refuge, the Friend; the Origin, the End the Preservation, the Treasurehouse, the Imperishable Seed.
sloka.hindi: gathir bhartha: prabhus sa:kshi: niva:sas saranam suhruth| prabhavah pralaya sttha:nam nidha:nam bi:jam avyayam || 18
sloka.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् | प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ||९-१८||

sloka.english: I give heat; I hold back and pour forth rain; I am deathlessness and also death. O Arjuna, Being and not-Being as well.
sloka.hindi: thapa:m yaham aham varsham nigrunha:m yuthsruja:mi cha | amrutham chaiva mruthyus cha sadasachcha:ham arjuna || 19
sloka.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च | अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ||९-१९||

sloka.english: Followers of the three Vedas, who drink the soma juice and are purged of sin, worship Me with sacrifice and pray for going to heaven; they reach the holy world of the gods and enjoy in heaven the divine joys of the gods.
sloka.hindi: thraividya: ma:m so:mapa:h pu:thapa:pa:ha yajnair ishtva: svargathim pra:rtthayanthe: | the: punyam a:sa:dya sure:ndra lo:kam asnanthi divyan divi de:vabho:ga:n || 20
sloka.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते | ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक- मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ||९-२०||

sloka.english: They enjoy the vast world of heaven, and their merit spent, they enter the world of the mortals; thus those who, following the Vedic law, long for the fruit of their action earn but the round of birth and death.
sloka.hindi: the: tham bhukthva: svargalo:kam visa:lam khsi:ne: punye: marthyalo:kam visanthi | evam thrayi: dharmam anuprapanna:ha gatha: gatham ka:maka:ma: labhanthe: || 21
sloka.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति | एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ||९-२१||

sloka.english: As for those who worship Me, thinking on Me alone and nothing else, ever attached to Me, I bear the burden of getting them what they need.
sloka.hindi: ana:nya:s chinthayantho: ma:m ye: jana:h paryupa:sathe: | thesha:m nithya:bhiyuktha:na:m yo:ga kshe:mam vaha:m yaham || 22
sloka.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते | तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||९-२२||

sloka.english: Even those who, devoted to other gods, worship them in full faith, even they, O Kaunteya, worship none but Me, though not according to the rule.
sloka.hindi: ye:th vanya devatha: bhaktha:ha yajanthe: sraddhaya::nvitha:ha | the::pi ma:m e:va kownthe:ya ! yajanth yavidhipu:rvakam || 23
sloka.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ||९-२३||

sloka.english: For I am the Acceptor and the Director of all sacrifices; but not recognizing Me as I am, they go astray.
sloka.hindi: aham hi sarva yajna:na:m bhoktha: cha prabhur e:va cha | na thu ma:m abhija:nanthi thathve:na: thaschyavanthi the: || 24
sloka.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च | न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ||९-२४||

sloka.english: Those who worship the gods go to the gods; those who worship the manes go to the manes; those who worship the spirits go to the spirits; but those who worship Me come to Me.
sloka.hindi: ya:nthi de:vavratha: de:va:n pitru:n ya:nthi pithru vratha:ha | bhu:tha:ni ya:nthi bhu:the:jya:ha ya:nthimad ya:jino::pi ma:m || 25
sloka.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः | भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ||९-२५||

sloka.english: Any offering of leaf, flower, fruit or water, made to Me in devotion, by an earnest soul, I lovingly accept.
sloka.hindi: pathram pushpam phalam tho:yam yo: me: bhakthya: prayacchathi | thad aham bhakth yupahrutham asna:mi prayatha:thmanaha || 26
sloka.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति | तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ||९-२६||

sloka.english: Whatever you doest, whatever you eatest, whatever you offerest as sacrifice or gift, whatever austerity you dost perform, O kaunteya, dedicate all to Me.
sloka.hindi: yath karo:shi yad asna:si yaj juho:si dada:si yath | yath thapasyasi kaunthe:ya ! thath kurushva madarpanam || 27
sloka.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् | यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||९-२७||

sloka.english: So doing you shall be released from the bondage of action, yielding good and evil fruit; having accomplished both renunciation and performance, you shall be released from birth and death and come unto Me.
sloka.hindi: subha:subha phalair e:vam mo:kshyase: karmabandhanaihi | sannya:sa yo:ga yuktha:thma: vimuktho: ma:m upaishyasi || 28
sloka.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः | संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ||९-२८||

sloka.english: I am the same to all beings; with Me there is non disfavoured, none favoured; but those who worship Me with devotion are in Me and I in them.
sloka.hindi: samo:: ham sarvabhu:the:shu na me: dve:shyo:sthi na priyaha | ye: bhajanthi thu ma:m bhakthya: mayi the: the:su cha:p yaham || 29
sloka.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः | ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ||९-२९||

sloka.english: A sinner, howsoever great, if he turns to Me with undivided devotion, must indeed be counted a saint; for he has a settled resolve.
sloka.hindi: api che:th sudura:cha:ro: bhajathe: ma:m ananyabha:k | sa:dhur e:va sa manthavayaha samyag vyavasitho: hi saha || 30
sloka.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् | साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ||९-३०||

sloka.english: For soon he becomes righteous and wins everlasting peace; know for a certainty, O kaunteya, that my bhakta never perishes.
sloka.hindi: kshipram bhavathi dharma:thma: sasvachha:nthim nigachhathi | kaunthe:ya prathija:ni:hi na me: bhakthah pranasyathi || 31
sloka.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति | कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ||९-३१||

sloka.english: For finding refuge in Me, even those who though are born of the womb of sin, women, vaishyas, and shudras too, reach the supreme goal.
sloka.hindi: ma:m hi pa:rttha vyapa:srithya ye::pi syuh pa:payo:nayaha | sthriyo: vaisya:s thattha: su:dra:ha the::pi ya:nthi para:m gathim || 32
sloka.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः | स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ||९-३२||

sloka.english: How much more then, the pure brahmanas and seer-kings who are my devotees? Do you worship Me, therefore, since you have come to this fleeting and joyless world.
sloka.hindi: kim punar bra:hmana:h punya:ha bhaktha: ra:jarshayas thattha:| anithyam asukham lo:kam imam pra:pya bhajasva ma:m || 33
sloka.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा | अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ||९-३३||

sloka.english: On Me fix thy mind, to Me bring thy devotion, to Me offer thy sacrifice, to Me make thy obeisance; thus having attached thyself to Me and made Me thy end and aim, to Me indeed shall you come.
sloka.hindi: manmana: bhava madbhaktho: madya:ji: ma:m namaskuru | ma:me: vaishyasi yukthvai vam a:thma:nam mathpara:yanaha || 34
sloka.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ||९-३४||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Yet once more, O Mahabahu, here My supreme word, which I will utter to thee, gratified one, for thy benefit.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha bhu:ya e:va maha:ba:ho: srunu me: paramam vachaha | yath the::ham pri:yama:na:ya vakshaya:mi hitha ka:myaya: || 1
sloka.sanskrit: अथ दशमोऽध्यायः | विभूतियोगः श्रीभगवानुवाच | भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः | यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||१०-१||

sloka.english: Neither the gods nor the great seers know My origin; for I am, every way, the origin of them both.
sloka.hindi: na me: vidus suragana:ha prabhavam na maharshayaha | aham a:dirhi de:va:na:m maharshi:na:m cha sarvasaha || 2
sloka.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः | अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||१०-२||

sloka.english: He who knows Me, the great lord of the worlds, as birthless and without beginning, he among mortals, undeluded, is released from sins.
sloka.hindi: yo:ma:m ajam ana:dim cha ve:ththi lo:ka mahe:svaram | asammu:ddas sa marthye:shu sarvapa:paih pramuchyathe: || 3
sloka.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् | असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||१०-३||

sloka.english: Discernment, knowledge, freedom from delusion, long suffering, truth, self-restraint, inward calm, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear and fearlessness;
sloka.hindi: buddir jna:nam asammo:haha kshama: sathyam damas samaha | sukham duhkham bhavo:: bha:vo: bhayam cha:bhayam e:vacha || 4
sloka.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः | सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ||१०-४||

sloka.english: Non-violence, even-mindedness, contentment, austerity, beneficence, good and ill fame, - all these various attributes of creatures proceed verily from Me.
sloka.hindi: ahimsa: samatha: thustthis thapo: da:nam, yaso::yasaha | bhavanthi bha:va: bhu:tha:na:m maththa e:va prutthag vidha:ha || 5
sloka.sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः | भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ||१०-५||

sloka.english: The seven great seers, the ancient four, and the Manus too were born of Me and of My mind, and of them were born all the creatures in the world.
sloka.hindi: maharshayas saptha pu:rve: chathva:ro: manavas thattha: | madbha:va: ma:nasa: ja:thaha ye:sha:m lo:ka ima:h praja:ha || 6
sloka.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा | मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ||१०-६||

sloka.english: He who knows in truth My immanence and My yoga becomes gifted with unshakable yoga; of this there is no doubt.
sloka.hindi: ye:tha:m vibhu:thim yo:gam cha mama yo: ve:ththi thathvathaha | so::vikampe:na yo:ge:na yu:jyathe: na:thra samsayaha || 7
sloka.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः | सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ||१०-७||

sloka.english: I am the source of all, all proceeds from me; knowing this, the wise worship Me with hearts full of devotion.
sloka.hindi: aham sarvasya prabhavo: maththas sarvam pravarthathe: | ithi mathva: bhajanthe: ma:m budha: bha:va samanvitha:ha || 8
sloka.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते | इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ||१०-८||

sloka.english: With me in their thoughts, their whole soul devoted to Me, teaching one another, with me ever on their lips, they live in contentment and joy.
sloka.hindi: mach chiththa:h madgatha pra:na:ha bo:dhayanthah parasparam | katthayanthas cha ma:m nithyam thushyanthi cha ramanthi cha || 9
sloka.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् | कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||१०-९||

sloka.english: To these, ever in tune with Me worshipping me with affectionate devotion, I give the power of selfless action, whereby they come to Me.
sloka.hindi: the:sha:m sathatha yuktha:na:m bhajatha:m pri:thi pu:rvakam | dada:mi buddhiyo:gam tham ye:na ma:m upaya:nthi the: || 10
sloka.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् | ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||१०-१०||

sloka.english: Out of every compassion for them, I who dwell in their hearts, destroy the darkness, born of ignorance, with the refulgent lamp of knowledge.
sloka.hindi: the:sha:m e:va:nukampa:rttham aham ajna:najam thamaha | na:saya:m ya:thma bha:vasttho: jna:na di:pe:na bha:svatha: || 11
sloka.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः | नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ||१०-११||

sloka.english: Arjuna Said: Lord! you art the supreme Brahman, the supreme Abode, the supreme Purifier! Everlasting Celestial Being, the Primal God, Unborn, All-pervading.
sloka.hindi: arjuna uva:cha param bramha param dha:ma pavithram param bhava:n | purusham sa:svatham divyam a:di:de:vam ajam vibhum || 12
sloka.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् | पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ||१०-१२||

sloka.english: Thus have all the seers - the divine seer Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa - declared Thee; and you Thyself dost tell me so.
sloka.hindi: a:husthva:mrushayas sarve: de:varshir na:radas thattha: | asitho: de:valo: vya:saha svayam chaiva bravi:shi me: || 13
sloka.sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा | असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||१०-१३||

sloka.english: All that you tellest me is true, I know, O Keshava, verily, Lord, neither the gods nor the demons know Thy manifestation.
sloka.hindi: sarvam e:thad rutham manye: yanma:m vadasi ke:sava | na hi the: bhagavan vyakthim vidur de:va:na da:nava:ha || 14
sloka.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव | न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ||१०-१४||

sloka.english: Thyself alone you knowest by Thyself, O Purushottama, O Source and Lord of all beings, God of Gods, O Ruler of the universe.
sloka.hindi: svayam e:va:thman a:thma:nam ve:thttha thvam purusho:ththma | bhu:thabha:vana bhu:the:sa de:va de:va jagath pathe: || 15
sloka.sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम | भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ||१०-१५||

sloka.english: Indeed you oughtest to tell me of all Thy manifestations, without a remainder, whereby you dost pervade the worlds.
sloka.hindi: vakthum arhas yase:she:na divya:hya:thma vibhu:thayaha || ya:bhir vibhu:thibhir lo:ka:n ima:m sthvam vya:pya thishtasi || 16
sloka.sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः | याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ||१०-१६||

sloka.english: O Lord! O Yogin! constantly meditating on Thee, how am I to know Thee? In what various aspects am I to think of Thee
sloka.hindi: kattham vidya:m aham yo:gi: thva:m sada: parichinthayan | ke:shu ke:shu cha bha:ve:shu chinthyo::si bhagava:n maya: || 17
sloka.sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् | केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||१०-१७||

sloka.english: Recount to me yet again, in full detail, Thy unique power and Thy immanence, O Janardana! For my ears cannot be sated with listening to Thy life-giving words.
sloka.hindi: visthare:na a:thmano: yo:gam vibhu:thim cha jana:rdana | bhu:yah katthaya thrupthirhi srunvatho: na:sthi me::mrutham || 18
sloka.sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन | भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||१०-१८||

sloka.english: The Lord Said: Yea, I will unfold to thee, O Kurushreshtha, My divine manifestations, - the chiefest only; for there is no limit to their extent.
sloka.hindi: sri: bhagava:n uva:cha hantha ! the: kattha ishya:mi vibhu:thi:r a:thmanas subha:ha | pra:dha:nyathah kurusre:shtta ! na:sthyantho: vistharasya me: || 19
sloka.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः | प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||१०-१९||

sloka.english: I am the Atman, O Gudakesha, seated in the heart of every being; I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
sloka.hindi: aham a:thma: guda:ke:sa sarvabhu:tha:saya stthithaha | aham a:discha madhyam cha bhu:tha:na:m antha ye:va cha || 20
sloka.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः | अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||१०-२०||

sloka.english: Of the Adityas I am Vishnu; of luminaries, the radiant Sun; of Maruts, I am Marichi; of constellations, the moon.
sloka.hindi: a:dithya:na:m aham vishnuhu jyo:thisha:m ravir amsuma:n | mari:chir marutha:m asmi nakshathra:na:m aham sasi: || 21
sloka.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् | मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ||१०-२१||

sloka.english: Of the Vedas I am the Sama Veda; of the gods Indra; of the senses I am the mind; of beings I am the consciousness.
sloka.hindi: ve:da:na:m sa:mave:do:smi de:va:na:m asmi va:savaha | indriya:na:m manas cha:smi bhu:tha:na:m asmi che:thana: || 22
sloka.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः | इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ||१०-२२||

sloka.english: Of Rudras I am Shankara; of Yakshas and Rakshasas Kubera; of Vasus I am the Fire; of mountains Meru.
sloka.hindi: rudra:na:m sankaras cha:smi viththe:so: yaksha rakshasa:m | vasu:na:m pavakas cha:smi me:rus sikharina:m aham || 23
sloka.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् | वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ||१०-२३||

sloka.english: Of priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief Brihaspati; of army captains I am Kartikeya; and of waters the ocean.
sloka.hindi: puro:dasa:m cha mukhyam ma:m viddhi pa:rttha ! bruhaspathim | se:na:ni:na:m aham skandas sarasa:m asmi sa:garaha || 24
sloka.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् | सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ||१०-२४||
